Reviews.Title: “"Short break" to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: FerierKarise_Denmark
Reviews.Content: Have just been to Berlin in the period 17 to 20 april and stayed this time at the hotel "Grand City Hotel Berlin Ku'Damm", which is close to excellent shopping at Kurfürstendamm. It is advisable to take bus 109 from the airport (Tegel) to stop "Ulandstr." from where there is only approx. 300 meters to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: WiganFireblade
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. The room was nothing flash, but did the job it was designed to do! After all, it's a bad holiday if you spend a lot of time in your room! The girl on the check-in desk was extremely pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was fairly straightforward- cold meats, toast, fruit juice, cereals, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, sausage meat 'medallions' etc. The only thing that was negative about the stay was some of the German guests there. They could be quite obnoxious if a group turned up wanting to sit by the fire en masse, and I was there already. They'd surround me and start asking about my religion, asking if I was Islamic etc. Very strange, really.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: vooLondon
Reviews.Content: The locations is great, short walk from shops, supermarket very close by, and coffee shops. The rom is what it says on the tin, compact and clean and for the price, it is very nice. From shonefeld airport, took me about 45 min. by train. I staied there on winter so it was very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Realy enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: Shahar1991
Reviews.Content: Just a lovely hotel! We loved the staff and the service was terrifac!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shoe box hell”
Reviews.Author: sheel57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit down at heel. Friendly reception staff duing the day but a harassed Polish security person who didn't speak any English at night. The room was the smallest I've ever stayed in. The single bed was tiny and sloped to the floor. I only managed a night's sleep by placing the mattress on the floor, difficult because there was not much floor to use!

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the price”
Reviews.Author: Bitboy
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat on price, good location (5 minute walk from Ku'damm and Uhrlandsrasse underground. Friendly staff, corridors look tired bur bedroom was spacious and clean. No problem getting a smoking room. Can't comment on breakfast as this was not inclded. Rooms at the front of hotel are noisy in the mornings because of traffic, not helped by mate insisting to keep window open. Highly recommend to people without kids travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westbury
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in December, and think this hotel can't be beaten for location, and good value. The public areas are welcoming, attractive and spotlessly clean. The staff are so polite, especially Thomas Braun, who went out of his way to confirm our flights, and give us helpful directions. The rooms (two singles) were clean, quiet and nicely furnished. The shower room had lots of hot water, and the towels were changed every day. We decided to pay extra for breakfast and were not diappointed. Good choice of cold meats, cheeses, and breads. There was also cereal, fruit, yogurt, and a hot savoury option. The Hotel is just off the main Ku'Damm shopping street. A short walk from the underground station, near to the tourist bus pick up, and has public a bus stop just opposite.There are lots of busy restaurants near by, one gorgeous one on the corner of Ku'Damm and Leitzenburger, owned by a charming lady.( Just can't remember the name of it! It has checked table cloths, and seves great Italian food) All in all, this Hotel is a great place to stay, and I would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not three stars”
Reviews.Author: snn1964
Reviews.Content: Of the advantages of the hotel - location, hearty breakfast and friendly service at a luncheon, a soft bed. That's it. Deficiencies and much more importantly - for the three months from the time of booking we were not able to provide a minimal request - a smoking room. On arrival we had to pay extra 20 euros per room better komfornosti as rooms booked price range were not available. "Best" comfort us, incidentally, is not found and was horrified to think that the same standard of comfort in the rooms. Rusty plumbing, retro hair dryers, and completely open wardrobe and I demonstrated in the photo.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: allroundale
Reviews.Content: Good location for a horrible hotel. The hotel is not really clean, prices change every night and the breakfast doesn't worth what it costs! We found expired milk, bread with mold... We payed EUR 105.- per person and per night but normally it costs EUR 50.- per room. In Berlin, for the same price it is plenty of better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: raulds
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not all bad but for sure you can find something better in Berlin by the same price. The staff in the front desk is not really friendly and pro-active. The hotel's wifi broke and during all the time I spent in there it was not fixed. Luck me all the Starbucks in Berlin has free wifi connection so I could contact my friends and family back home. The mattress they use is good but they have the worst pillows ever. The rooms are clean but you can notice the hotel needs to be renewed together the management. Also the hallways are a bitty smelly and seems dirty. Typical from old hotels with bad maintenance. Some good things: The rooms are big enough. The shower is good but could be better. Great location, near an U-Bahn station and plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but tired looking rooms”
Reviews.Author: ianadam
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel but were disappointed with the room we had, there was six of us staying and we had 4 rooms. We had booked a family room but were told at check in that we had only booked a double. After a chat they did change the room but it was hard work. In the room we had one very small wardrobe but no drawers to store clothes. The bathroom was ok but not great also I don’t think the floor in our room was vacuumed during our stay. Also one of the rooms smelled of smoke. The reception and restaurant/bar area has been done up and was very nice. We paid extra for the breakfast and it was good with a great choice of food and drink. The hotel has a car park in the basement that we used one night but the spaces are all very tight so watch your bumpers. The location is great with S Bahn and U Bahn station all within 5 mins walk also there is a stop for all of the tour buses just 10 mins walk from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Cosmetic enhancements fail to mask real problems”
Reviews.Author: SJonazzle
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt this hotel looks very pleasant - modern and funky interior on arrival, very pleasant reception staff will welcome you in. However there is a problem, and the problem is essentially the accommodation. A lick of paint cannot save these rooms (whitewashing over woodchip seems to be a particular favourite here). They are still in need of desperate modernisation. In particular the bathroom. We had a superior room but this did not save us. The shower was a perfunctory affair (although mercifully the water was hot), and there was central heating. However, there was no air conditioning in our Superior room, and it seemed like there was nothing in the walls either - we were woken very frequently by neighbouring rooms and people simply walking past our room in the communal corridor. Service at the bar was slow and breakfast is pricey but can't fault the location though which is great for the Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Grand City Hotel Berlin Kudamm”
Reviews.Author: Raini
Reviews.Content: rooms: I was there with my girlfriend and her mother our double-room was very large, her single room was very small. My first impression was that the hotel looked old and tired but I realised that, it was only because of the very 70'ish carpet, if that was changed it would look up-to-date. Restaurant: we only used the restaurant for the breakfast buffet, it was nice, and had a lot to choose from The staff: the staff in the reception was very sweet and helpful, but the cleaning ladies was extremely slow, and a bit rude, they werent finished with the rooms before 16-17 and the day we arrived we were told that our room would be finished 15:30 but the cleaning lady was busy looking at some TV-show in our room instead of cleaning it so we had to wait another 30 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitsos6
Reviews.Content: Very small single room, staff at reception desk could not find our names and would not let us in both on the first and second night. Woke up at 5 am with my room (on the 4th floor) smelling fried eggs and sausages, obviously from a kitchen vent than went through the room vent. Skip the breakfast if you can, it's ok but not worth the 17 €.

Reviews.Title: “Quality yet low-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Senorbrown
Reviews.Content: Easy to find if walking from Bahnhof Zoo underground. A welcome from the first moment. Everything very effective and clean. Tidy and functional rooms, hot water as soon as you touch the tap or in the shower. Use of the safe by the reception is gratis. TV has a variety of channels, including serious German, meaning that you gain contact with the country and not the tabloid nonsense of Sky News, etc. The breakfast lounge - same site as the restaurant - faces a well-kept garden, while the assortment of food, especially the selection of nourishing bread, should find favour with all clients. A large coffee can is placed on every table so you don't have to get up and down for another cup. Waitresses are beautiful young women, while NO music disturbs the eaters.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended very disapponting”
Reviews.Author: WinterLisbon
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms for myself and friends in December 2008 requesting twin rooms on the same floor (plenty of time to arrange correct rooms). On arrival all rooms were doubles and 2 were on the 6th floor and 1 on the 3rd floor. There was no lift to the 6th floor only to the 5th floor and then a climb up the stairs to the 6th. Rooms on the 6th floor were basic but clean. The 3rd floor room was very small no bath only a shower wash basin and toilet (room 314) very disappointing) my friends asked for a room change and there was not one available. Staff mostly friendly although male staff on reception had no time for us never even asked it we had had a good time(perhaps it was because we were women on our own). It was a good location, good restaurants and shops near by. Friendly taxi driver from the airport who picked us to take us back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: daxs
Reviews.Content: worst hotel ive been to room very very small some light did not work room was not very clean very out dated rubbish in hallways [was not whot i sour in the picters of the hotel] walk out in 10 mins of seeing my room. on the hight site the starf were nice

Reviews.Title: “great value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandWeekender
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a weekend break in Hotel Imperial Berlin and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for good clean accomodation, great food & choice for breakfast and brilliant location, parallel to Kurfurstedam street (KuDam)., For value this hotel cannot be faulted - we went on the shoppers trip cost €202 per couple for two nights & it included B&B both mornings and one eveing candelit meal - brilliant. We all fully intend to return to Berlin again as we definately didn;t get to see everything we wanted and would book this hotel again no problem

Reviews.Title: “I agree! Good value, good location.”
Reviews.Author: artyhues
Reviews.Content: Although I ended up in Berlin during the transit strike, I liked this hotel. Very nice part of town, with some cool places to eat nearby. The room was fairly clean and the bathroom O.K. There were a few bedbugs. After about 5 days, the strike ended, and this turned into a great location for seeing the city, with a bus stop across the street, and the U-bahn a block away. I tried the hotel restaurant once, but it wasn't that good. Neither did I pay for the overpriced breakfast. Much better deals nearby. Also, ask for a room overlooking Lietzenburger Straße, as the rear view is rather plain. Helpful staff. Hotel computer, (which was often busy).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in an Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: TramTourist
Reviews.Content: This is a cracking little hotel in a central location. Although it may not look much from the outside, the inside immediately gives the impression of a 3-star hotel with a large lobby and efficient and friendly receptionist. The reception area also includes a computer with free internet access which seemed to be in constant use by guests. Although I had only booked a single room at a bargain discount rate, I was given a double which whilst compact, was clean and well furnished and quite adequate for two people to move around and spend the night in. There was a mini-bar fridge but no in-room safe A buffet breakfast is offered at an extra £12 a day, but I declined this and decided to "self cater" - there is a small supermarket round the corner on Uhland Strasse which is open until 10pm, 6 days a week (although allow plenty of time as it can get quite busy). There are also plenty of Cafe's and bars nearby. The hotel is approx 5 minutes walk from the Uhland Str. metro station which is the start of U-bahn line 1 which runs through the centre of Berlin. The Zoologischer Garden (Zoo) station is about 15 minutes walk away or you can take bus 249 which runs every 10 minutes and stops 2 mins away from the hotel. All in all, if you are looking for a quality hotel in the centre of West Berlin but are on a budget , I would heartily recommend the Imperial. However you may need to shop around on the hotel booking sites to get the best deal (I used hoteldiscount.com which seems to be related to TravelNow.com).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mimolandia
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Imperial Berlin and recommend it for others. The location was within walking distance to the bus route, underground train station and many eating establishments. Hard Rock Cafe Berlin was just around the corner. The accommodations/rooms were average in that they were very clean, on the small side, however, the carpets were a bit worn. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast, which can be purchased with the room, was worth it as it provided a wide variety of selections of breads, cold cut meats, cheese and eggs, sausage, bacon and coffee, tea and juices. The rooms were very quiet as we were on the side of the hotel opposite of the street. They had free access to internet, which was unexpected and great to check your emails quickly, as long as you are used to a european keyboard. I would highly recommend staying here for a few days on your next tour to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and good location”
Reviews.Author: HAKANORLOFF
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Perfect, 2-3 min walk to Berlins biggest shoppingstreet (Kurfürstendamm St.). HOTEL: Clean, absolutely no luxury - but inexpensive! No in-room safe. Lots of TV-channel incl. BBC and CNN. Small singlerooms. STAFF: Very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Imperial good base for Berlin (albeit not very 'Imperial)”
Reviews.Author: ShoelessJeff
Reviews.Content: After wrapping-up business in Dusseldorf last month, I took in an extended weekend in one of my favorite world cities: Berlin (yes, Berlin!). My base was the Imperial Hotel. As has become my m.o. when posting reviews here, I have broken this review down into the Great, the Good, the Bad, and the Ugly. I will then offer some bottom line / recommendations and answer THE reviewer question (would I do it again?) GREAT # 1 - While there is nothing particularly great about this tourist class hotel, I really love the rate I got two weekend nights at: $69 USD (about E 46 at the time) per night! They have a graduating rate scale at this hotel - whereby the lesser price you choose, the less flexibility and ammenities you get. That WAS great. GOOD # 1 - I really love where the hotel is located - just a few minutes off the Ku'Damm in the very nice Charlottenberg (sp?) area. # 2 - While this is a tourist-class hotel, a business traveler would not be out of place. The staff are professional & friendly and the bar & restaurant area are very nice. # 3 - There is a nice little in-house sauna that is included with your stay (be familiar with attire norms) # 4 - They do a great breakfast buffet that goes a bit over & above most tourist Euro hotels, but . . . it is not included with the room in every price bracket and it is not cheap (E 14) BAD (room for improvement) # 1 - The rooms are typical Euro-small and not very modern. I didn't have a problem (how could I at E 46 / nite?) with this as they are well-cleaned, but be warned if you are picky. I was fine as I was traveling solo, but if you are not, you may feel a little squeezed. UGLY # 1 - The door locking procedure is a potential fire safety hazard and not secure. You get a metal key (that you have to leave at the front desk) that you use to unlock your door, but . . . unless you use the key to lock the door from the inside it stays unlocked! Likewise, if you leave your room you have to lock your door from the outside - just closing it will not lock it. I'm sure people miss that all of the time and I'd bet if you went down a hall and tried doors at random A LOT of them would be unlocked. Worse yet, if you do use your key to lock the door from the inside and can't quickly find your key you could be in effect 'locked IN' - a real fire hazard. BOTTOM LINE / RECOMMENDATIONS # 1 - I feel like this little tourist-class hotel is a good find. Compare similar priced hotels and you will struggle to top it. But . . . come with accurately calibrated expectations (that applies anywhere, really) # 2 - Take at least one night and eat close to the hotel - there are a number of great restauarants between the hotel on Uhlandstrasse and the Uhlandstrasse U-Bahn station (the closest U-bahn stop) A good hotel and solid value - a good base for exploring a great funky, vibey city! e-mail me at jefnac@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jeakel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a one week stay at the Hotel Imperial Berlin and would comment as follows: The staff were always polite and smiling on the reception desk. Our room was cleaned very thoroughly each day, the bathroom being especially clean. Due to the hot weather our room did get very stuffy at night and with no air conditioning we did open our window, but found it did not help our sleep due to the all-night traffic and people passing by (our room was on the front of the hotel). We had a wonderful candlelight four-course dinner (for a very reasonable price) and cannot fault the service or the chef! The hotel is a short walk to the Kurfurstendamm area with plenty of bars and restaurants, U-bahn and S-bahn stations (both of which we used regularly). We would definitely stay there again. It was moderately priced and other than lack of air-conditioning, we could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “heavy maintenance needed”
Reviews.Author: alex.orange
Reviews.Content: I guess the hotel provides better rooms and services but I've to evaluate what was my experience and right now I'm having hard times to find anything good to say about this property. The staff weren't unfriendly or rude, just not helpful or welcoming and when you think that this was the best part, you can get an idea of how far this place is from being a good 3 star hotel. The toilette had dark stains that didn't give you the idea of a clean place. I found it almost funny that their welcome card suggests to use the safe, making me assume that there was one in each room. To be fair I've to mention that after having left Berlin they informed me that a safe was available at the desk, but you can guess how useful that info was to me at that point. The worst part anyway, was the lack of air-conditioning in the room, I'm still extremely surprised that a 3-star hotel might have rooms without it. In the morning the room was so hot, that I actually felt relieved once I was in the corridor. The feeling I got is that there are rooms which are nice and clean like the one you see in their site and other rooms which have major flaws, like the one I got (105). If you really want to stay here make sure to get the first ones otherwise look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel. Well placed near an area populated with good quality (reasonably priced) restaurants. And well placed near an under ground station (200 m). The hotel was very clean adn the staff helpful. We didn't eat in the hotel, so can't comment on the food. Definately recommend this place.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand City Hotel Berlin Kudamm
HotelInfo.Address: Lietzenburger Strasse 79-81, 10719 Berlin, Germany
